Reviews.Title: “So peaceful you can't believe you're in Madrid-center”
Reviews.Author: MonicaEP
Reviews.Content: It has been an absolute surprise to discover this place. It's a cute "palacete" just beside the M-30, in a little residential street with no traffic at all, buildings are just on one side and the other is plenty of big trees, so the surroundings are perfect if you travel with children or want a quiet place. But if you walk just two minutes you are in a busy area with restaurants and anything you need. The staff were really kind, the room is very big and you can have a cot with no charge and also an extra bed at a reasonable price, so it's perfect when you travel with two kids, as many hotels in Madrid allow only one kid for room (a great nonsense I will never understand, what are you supposed to do? Hire two rooms and sleep appart from my husband? Give away one of my sons?...) We had the buffet breakfast at the very elegant restaurant downstairs (it was included in the offer) and again everything was a delight, the assortment, the staff, the coffee (an important thing for me is to have a good expresso in the mornings, I don't like at all those machines that make a powder-milk and watery coffee), you can ask for other things if they don't have them on show. Could I ask for more? The only negative tip is that they have so few rooms, so it's plenty for next october, when I was planning to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: steveojones
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night for work. Lovely helpful reception staff, great room service, a room that wasn't 40 degrees, and comfy bed. All for €150 what more could you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: FoixBarcelona
Reviews.Content: A little bit out of the centre, but perfect if you go by car or plan to visit towns around Madrid. Excellent service and restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Nice option but sounds better than it is”
Reviews.Author: ERS_C_and_A
Reviews.Content: If the location works for you (not a good choice for visiting museums or sights in old Madrid) it is a nice, different option from other hotels in the area ... but surprising to see other reviews saying it is luxurious (well past its prime) or central

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and cozy, amazingly quiet for being in Madrid. Excelent service.”
Reviews.Author: Halvar40
Reviews.Content: I was there with my partner in a summer sightseeing trip in Madrid. I found it easy to arrive there by car from the airport, no need to drive on the messy downtown. The hotel is a hidden surprise in northern Madrid, silent and quiet; it doesn't feel like being in the noisy capital of Spain. The cozy garden, the restaurant with the terrace by the garden, the discreet service....That makes a difference, and it paid for the distance to downtown (easy to reach anyway by Madrid's safe underground, or by taxi) We stayed in one of the bungalows (well, I wouldn't say those are bungalows, they were almost like semi-detached little houses!) at the back of the main house. That was perfect for a weekend trip like this. I strongly recommend this hotel if you don't mind too much about being far from downtown.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Quinta De Los Cedros
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Allendesalazar, 4, 28043 Madrid, Spain
